channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- API Connect
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- API Connect

item.title: CVE-2019-4008|2024-08-04T19:26:27.796Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: API Connect V2018.1 through 2018.4.1.1 is impacted by access token leak. Authorization tokens in some URLs can result in the tokens being written to log files. IBM X-Force ID: 155626.

item.title: CVE-2019-4052|2024-08-04T19:26:27.986Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 2018.1 and 2018.4.1.2 apis can be leveraged by unauthenticated users to discover login ids of registered users. IBM X-Force ID: 156544.

item.title: CVE-2020-4640|2024-08-04T08:07:49.054Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: Certain IBM API Connect 10.0.0.0 through 10.0.1.0 and 2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.13 configurations can result in sensitive information in the URL fragment identifiers. This information can be cached in the intermediate nodes like proxy servers, cdn, logging platforms, etc. An attacker can make use of this information to perform attacks by impersonating a user. IBM X-Force ID: 185510.

item.title: CVE-2020-4706|2024-08-04T08:14:57.542Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 5.0.0.0 through 5.0.8.10 is vulnerable to HTTP header injection, caused by improper validation of input by the HOST headers. By sending a specially crafted HTTP request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject HTTP HOST header, which will allow the attacker to conduct various attacks against the vulnerable system, including cross-site scripting, cache poisoning or session hijacking. IBM X-Force ID: 187194.

item.title: CVE-2019-4382|2024-08-04T19:33:38.203Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 5.0.0.0 through 5.0.8.6 could allow an unauthorized user to obtain sensitive information about the system users using specially crafted HTTP requests. IBM X-Force ID: 162162.

item.title: CVE-2020-4638|2024-08-04T08:07:49.163Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect's API Manager 2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.12 is vulnerable to privilege escalation. An invitee to an API Provider organization can escalate privileges by manipulating the invitation link. IBM X-Force ID: 185508.

item.title: CVE-2019-4437|2024-08-04T19:33:37.987Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 2018.1 through 2018.4.1.6 may inadvertently leak sensitive details about internal servers and network via API swagger. IBM X-force ID: 162947.

item.title: CVE-2019-4600|2024-08-04T19:40:47.879Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect version V5.0.0.0 through 5.0.8.7 could reveal sensitive information to an attacker using a specially crafted HTTP request. IBM X-Force ID: 167883.

item.title: CVE-2019-4051|2024-08-04T19:26:27.949Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: Some URIs in IBM API Connect 2018.1 and 2018.4.1.3 disclose system specification information like the machine id, system uuid, filesystem paths, network interface names along with their mac addresses. An attacker can use this information in targeted attacks. IBM X-Force ID: 156542.

item.title: CVE-2020-4337|2024-08-04T08:00:07.920Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.12 could allow an attacker to launch phishing attacks by tricking the server to generate user registration emails that contain malicious URLs. IBM X-Force ID: 177933.

item.title: CVE-2020-4828|2024-08-04T08:14:59.124Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 10.0.0.0 through 10.0.1.0 and 2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.13 is vulnerable to web cache poisoning, caused by improper input validation by modifying HTTP request headers. IBM X-Force ID: 189842.

item.title: CVE-2020-4346|2024-08-04T08:00:07.120Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect's V2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.10 management server has an unsecured api which can be exploited by an unauthenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 178322.

item.title: CVE-2019-4203|2024-08-04T19:33:36.924Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 5.0.0.0 and 5.0.8.6 Developer Portal can be exploited by app developers to download arbitrary files from the host OS and potentially carry out SSRF attacks. IBM X-Force ID: 159124.

item.title: CVE-2021-38997|2024-08-04T01:58:17.566Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect V10.0.0.0 through V10.0.5.0, V10.0.1.0 through V10.0.1.7, and V2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.19 is vulnerable to HTTP header injection, caused by improper validation of input by the HOST headers. This could allow an attacker to conduct various attacks against the vulnerable system, including cross-site scripting, cache poisoning or session hijacking. IBM X-Force ID: 213212.

item.title: CVE-2020-4707|2024-08-04T08:14:57.824Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 5.0.0.0 through 5.0.8.11 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 187370.

item.title: CVE-2020-4826|2024-08-04T08:14:59.133Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 10.0.0.0 through 10.0.1.0 and 2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.13 is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery which could allow an attacker to execute malicious and unauthorized actions transmitted from a user that the website trusts. IBM X-Force ID: 189840.

item.title: CVE-2019-4256|2024-08-04T19:33:37.799Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 5.0.0.0 through 5.0.8.6 uses weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 159944.

item.title: CVE-2020-4838|2024-08-04T08:14:58.992Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 5.0.0.0 through 5.0.8.10 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 190036.

item.title: CVE-2019-4402|2024-08-04T19:33:37.962Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 2018.1 through 2018.4.1.6 developer portal could allow an unauthorized user to cause a denial of service via an unprotected API. IBM X-Force ID: 162263.

item.title: CVE-2019-4553|2024-08-04T19:40:47.307Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect V5.0.0.0 through 5.0.8.7iFix3 uses weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 165958.

item.title: CVE-2019-4444|2024-08-04T19:33:37.959Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 2018.1 through 2018.4.1.7 Developer Portal's user registration page does not disable password autocomplete. An attacker with access to the browser instance and local system credentials can steal the credentials used for registration. IBM X-Force ID: 163453.

item.title: CVE-2019-4202|2024-08-04T19:33:37.533Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 5.0.0.0 and 5.0.8.6 Developer Portal is vulnerable to command injection. An attacker with a specially crafted request can run arbitrary code on the server and gain complete access to the system. IBM X-Force ID: 159123.

item.title: CVE-2020-4827|2024-08-04T08:14:58.295Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 10.0.0.0 through 10.0.1.0 and 2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.13 is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery which could allow an attacker to execute malicious and unauthorized actions transmitted from a user that the website trusts. IBM X-Force ID: 189841.

item.title: CVE-2019-4155|2024-08-04T19:33:37.502Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect's Developer Portal 2018.1 and 2018.4.1.3 is impacted by a privilege escalation vulnerability when integrated with an OpenID Connect (OIDC) user registry. IBM X-Force ID: 158544.

item.title: CVE-2020-4825|2024-08-04T08:14:59.158Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 10.0.0.0 through 10.0.1.0 and 2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.13 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 189839.

item.title: CVE-2020-4251|2024-08-04T08:00:07.073Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 5.0.0.0 through 5.0.8.8 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 175489.

item.title: CVE-2019-4609|2024-08-04T19:40:48.314Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 2018.4.1.7 uses weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 168510.

item.title: CVE-2020-4903|2024-08-04T08:14:59.126Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect V10 and V2018 could allow an attacker who has intercepted a registration invitation link to impersonate the registered user or obtain sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 191105.

item.title: CVE-2020-4452|2024-08-04T08:07:48.801Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect V2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.11 uses weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 181324.

item.title: CVE-2020-4195|2024-08-04T08:00:07.079Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect V2018.4.1.0 through 2018.4.1.10 could allow a remote attacker to hijack the clicking action of the victim. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to hijack the victim's click actions and possibly launch further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 174859.

item.title: CVE-2020-4695|2024-08-04T08:14:57.902Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect V10 is impacted by insecure communications during database replication. As the data replication happens over insecure communication channels, an attacker can view unencrypted data leading to a loss of confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2020-4899|2024-08-04T08:14:58.880Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 5.0.0.0 through 5.0.8.10 could potentially leak sensitive information or allow for data corruption due to plain text transmission of sensitive information across the network. IBM X-Force ID: 190990.

item.title: CVE-2019-4460|2024-08-04T19:33:38.356Z -- ibm -- api%20connect
item.description: IBM API Connect 5.0.0.0 through 5.0.8.6 developer portal could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 163681.
